snippet: When the time came to choose medical treatment for Malala Yousafzai, who was gunned down by the Taliban, her family faced a world of possibilities.
abstract: Family and doctors of Malala Yousafzai, 14-year-old Pakistani schoolgirl gunned down by Taliban, face array of possibilities in choosing medical treatment for her, as offers of assistance come from around the world, but they fly her to specialized hospital in Birmingham, England, where doctors have experience treating British soldiers wounded by Taliban.

byline.contributor: Adam B. Ellick contributed reporting from Cambridge, Mass., and John F. Burns from London.

lead_paragraph: When the time came to choose medical treatment for Malala Yousafzai, who was gunned down by the Taliban, her family faced a world of possibilities.

headline.seo: Girl Shot by Taliban Arrives in Britain for Treatment
headline.main: Global Outpouring to Help Pakistani Schoolgirl
headline.print_headline: Pakistani Girl in Britain for Care After Shooting
